name: Mixed Bag 41 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the curved front of a toboggan called?
questions.explanation:
Hood.

	The length of a toboggan is from three to eight feet. They usually seat up to four people.

questions.text: What is the part of a key that you hold called?
What is the smoke from a pipe called?
questions.explanation:
Lunt.

	It is a misconception that pipe smoking is less hazardous than cigarette smoking.

questions.text: What does the world's oldest army guard?
questions.explanation:
Vatican.

	(Papal Guard) The Swiss guard formed in 1505 by Pope Julius the second consists of 60 officers and 110 men.

questions.text: What was the destination that the Titanic never reached?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	It sailed from Southampton. It sank in less than 3 hours after hitting an iceberg. About 1513 of the 2200 passengers died.

questions.text: In what century was the piano discovered?
questions.explanation:
18th.

	In 1709.It is considered a stringed instrument derived from the harpsichord and the clavichord. Earliest known model (1709) built by Bartolomeo Cristofori a harpsichord maker of Florence, Italy. He is generally credited with inventing the piano.

questions.text: Which of the following plants is a dicot?
questions.explanation:
Cauliflower.

	This is a popular name for dicotyledons.

questions.text: Who played the role of Lou Gehrig in 'The Pride Of The Yankees'?
questions.explanation:
Gary Cooper.

	It was a 1942 biography of Lou Gehrig.

questions.text: According to the song where did Puff The Magic Dragon live?
questions.explanation:
Honah Lee.

	A 1963 hit by Peter, Paul and Mary.

questions.text: What kind of animal was Chilly Willy?
questions.explanation:
Penguin.

	He was created by Walter Lantz who also created Woody Woodpecker and Andy Panda.
